meanings.definition: Resembling a cell in structure or function.
meanings.sent1: The cytoid structure of the plant cell was fascinating to study.
meanings.sent2: The scientist observed the cytoid characteristics of the bacteria under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The cytoid shape of the toy cell made it look like a tiny building block.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like cytoid cells, each one connected and functioning independently.
meanings.sent5: The cytoid pattern on the butterfly's wings was a beautiful sight to behold.

meanings.sent1: Under the microscope, the cytoid appeared as a tiny, round cell.
meanings.sent2: The cytoid in the pond water was so small that it was barely visible.
meanings.sent3: The cytoid in the science kit looked like a miniature version of a real cell.
meanings.sent4: The cytoid floated in the liquid, resembling a tiny island in a vast ocean.
meanings.sent5: The cytoid structure was so small that it could easily be mistaken for a speck of dust.
